intro: Anomopanax versteegii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by berries containing a single seed. It is often found in moist forest understories and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
